body:
Very awesome work.
:+1:

I think this should gracefully handle an empty mirror list and show a "Quick download is not available, please select Advanced install to copy assets from an original game disk" dialog.  This will avoid breakage if we decide/need to remove our online asset mirrors.

Updated:
- Fixed csproj additions
- Fixed the margins and improved the wording of the asset installation prompt:
  ![screen shot 2016-05-31 at 22 52 05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/15691759/8951f17e-2782-11e6-95b8-9f701769b62a.png)
- Added a graceful fallback if no mirrors are available:
  ![screen shot 2016-05-31 at 22 50 49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/15691793/b445be60-2782-11e6-9c1a-cc09462e7f8c.png)
- Added truncation for long status labels (fixes #10556)

This uses Assets/Content inconsistently through the UI.  We should standardize on one or the other.

My preference is probably to go with something different: "resources".  Does anyone else have an opinion?

Feedback from social media doesn't indicate that it ever resulted in confusion or misunderstandings, so you are probably just fixing your personal urge to unify the wordings, but that is fine as well.
Updated.
Code looks good so far. Haven't actually installed anything with it yet, will do that tomorrow.
Also, do you feel like writing a little blurb for https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Mod-manifest? :smile:
Works very well, good job! :+1: once the temp file is properly cleaned up.
Added the temp file deletion.
Confirmation that the Dune 2000 video installation works on Windows :white_check_mark:  from https://www.reddit.com/r/openra/comments/4n0rdw/how_to_play_dune2k_cutscenes/d44vfli

It currently crashes


when you don't define sources for automatic installation:

``` yaml
ModContent:
    InstallPromptMessage: Red Alert 2 requires artwork and audio from the original game.
    HeaderMessage: At the moment only a manual installation is supported.\n\nPlease refer to https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/wiki#content
    Packages:
        base: Base Game Files
            TestFiles: ^Content/ra2/ra2.mix, ^Content/ra2/language.mix, ^Content/ra2/multi.mix
            Required: true
        music: Base Game Music
            TestFiles: ^Content/ra2/theme.mix
```

@Mailaender: That happened because you didn't define any discs.  I fixed your crash, and also left you a present in https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/pull/233.

The new mscab parser means that @obrakmann should probably recheck at least that code.

Works :white_check_mark: 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/16054120/16052e94-326c-11e6-841c-2c8f24461848.png)
Might be worth putting those lengthy definitions in their own `content.yaml` and just reference a list of MiniYaml definitions like we do for most of the rest.

> Might be worth putting those lengthy definitions in their own content.yaml and just reference a list of MiniYaml definitions like we do for most of the rest.

I agree in principle, but in practice this is tricky because this metadata is used by the modchooser, and loading cross-mod assets is a bit tricky.
Fixed d2k linux metadata.  Can you please retest?
Confirmed :white_check_mark: Dune 2000 CD installation is fixed now.

Still looks good to me. Can't really test the ms-cab extraction, though, the only .cabs I found here are Installshield ones (with the ISc\* format header)

Still, :+1:
[Changelog](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Changelog-%28bleed%29/_compare/51bce65fee22e55479ccedfcf0124d6cf68d0d39)

Hey guys,

I own a TFD disc; how can I help? What do you mean by metadata in this context?
You can help test https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11536.
Is this a firstrun-only prompt like the current one? It would greatly benefit from main menu/settings menu access in the event the user would prefer to add the extra content later.
No, it isn't. The Manage Content is always available next to the Play button in the mod selection menu.

Example:
![screen shot 2016-08-13 at 7 25 52 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12602985/17642474/17af80c4-618c-11e6-9cbd-813bea25dd21.png)
There was no playtest or release since this got merged.

Oh ok, that's a relief. The fact that imports can only happen on the first run of any mod (the exception being music) rubbed me the wrong way a bit.

As for my recently deleted comment, I short-circuited a bit there for a second, misunderstood what I was reading, big herpaderp on my part.
